I'm excited to announce the launch of a project I've been working on for a few years now!

I hate parenting books... So I decided to write one for the rest of us. Things with applicable tidbits like, “What to do when your kid flips off the bus driver?” and "When all else fails, get your kids an imaginary dog."
It’s real and funny and hopefully, you'll find it really funny.
Strategic Neglect: The art of #winning at parenting. A book written by me, for the rest of us.
Sign up to download the first chapter and start #winning at parenting.
Thx Reid Markel, Amber Pechin (Price), Ryan Mores, Ryan Wood and of course Susan for participating in my #presentation #workshop.
The biggest opportunity of my life landed in my inbox.
Earlier this year a friend-of-a-friend called me.
He wanted to launch a fitness app.
Busy as hell, fully booked up, knowing he couldn’t afford my rate -
We talked about platforms to use, product design, launch strategy.
Things companies pay me handsomely to talk about.
Six months later I woke up to an email that made my year.
From a company every freelancer dreams of working for.
Turns out my friend-of-a-friend knew a product manager there.
And he was leading out a huge new project.
This call was the highest paying free consultation I’ve ever given.
I worked on one of the biggest projects of my career.
And I’m on their shortlist for future engagement.
You never know what it can lead to.
I don't want him working remote.
Today, I sent an offer letter to him.
We want to hire the best.
And we like hiring people we work next to.
Communicating via Slack and email isn't enough.
We treat our employees as friends.
And no one likes long distance with their friends.
When we hire friends, we see more creative energy in the workplace.
It's harder to let friends go.
It's harder to promote certain friends over others.
Most of them don't live close to our L.A. office.
We make exceptions to hire them.
We start them on a one-month remote contract.
If we like them, then we pay for them to find a place in Los Angeles.
Hiring has been the hardest part of growing a business.
You invest so much time, then don't see the R.O.I.
Then with some hires, you see it right away.
As a 26-year-old founder, I know one thing is true:
Because you don't start a business to change the world.
You start a business to choose the people you work with.
And if you work 10-hour days next to them?
Telling stories and translating complex ideas into easily understood, exciting narratives.

Work on a team of public relations professionals across multiple accounts requiring organization, high levels of internal and external communications and time management. Accounts include: -RA Sushi-Universal Technical Institute-Motorcycle Mechanics Institute-Abrazo Community Health NetworkSome duties include: -Strategic media planning (traditional, social)-Media pitching and media relations-Interviewing clients and crafting stories for internal and external distribution-AP style writing-Relationship building with clients and media
Public Relations Director / Vice President of PRSSA

Ogden Peak Communications is a student run PR firm on Weber State Campus.  As the Public Relations Director I manage the web design, Newsletter publication, Blog publications, and planned events for the firm. As the Vice President I managed teams of students, advised on internal issue resolution, and advised on client communication and acquisition.   -Managed teams of students for three semesters-Created websites to promote the club and the Student firm-Creation and management of social media accounts-Edited and wrote content for blog and monthly newsletter

I was very involved in the communication department as a student. I was a contributor to the department facebook page, organized the booth for the block party, was the vice president of PRSSA and helped run the student run public relations firm.  I graduated with departmental honors as the distinguished graduate for public relations and advertising.  I was also awarded Public Relations Student of the Year and was the commencement speaker for Fall 2013.

Implemented the Social Media and PR plan I created and pitched for the Student of the Year competition. -Creative strategy and planning-Social media planning and execution-Tracked social media statistics and analytics-Content research and creation for blogs-Photography, videography-Press release writing and trafficking-Media relationships, media pitching-Sponsor relations
Public Relations, Advertising, and Applied Communication
Member of Lambda Pi Eta Honor's Society

I have been very involved in the Communications Department helping to plan and execute special events and promotions, managing the department Facebook page and in executive leadership of the Weber State Chapter of Public Relations Student Society of America (PRSSA).

Heart Effect is a philanthropic group whose mission is to support the lifesaving work, research and technology of the Phoenix Children’s Heart Center and Cardiac 3D Print Lab. Through community events, family support, fundraising efforts and partnerships with community organizations and donors, Heart Effect seeks to Educate, Change and Serve the Congenital Heart Defect (CHD) community.

Operation Underground Railroad (O.U.R.) is an organization which helps to liberate children enslaved in the sex trade industry. Using cutting-edge computer technology and human intelligence, O.U.R. undercover teams of former CIA and Special Ops personnel go into the darkest corners of the world to help local law enforcement liberate enslaved children and dismantle the criminal networks. In less than a year, O.U.R. has liberated over 250 children and arrested numerous traffickers.The Phoenix Rescue Run is an annual 5K to raise funds and awareness for Operation Underground Railroad and to fund rescue missions.

Amber is the single most driven person I know. She is an exceptional leader who can both manage people, befriend them, and mold them into a cohesive team. Amber is a born manager; she sets well thought out achievable goals. If someone on the team can't meet their goal Amber will step in and graciously pick up the slack without making the person feel inadequate. If I am ever in the position to hire, Amber would be at the top of my list; not only because she is a friend, but also because I would be lucky to have her on my team again.

Jessica Goble
Public Relations and Communications Specialist
November 22, 2015, Amber was senior to Jessica but didn’t manage directly

I have had the pleasure of working with Jessica as part of the public relations team during her internship at Cramer-Krasselt. She is a natural relationship builder, making friends everywhere she goes, drawing people to her warm, engaging personality.  Her ability to instinctively connects the dots when working on projects allows her to understand our clients and their needs and creatively figure out how to best get results that move the needle. She is fearless, jumping headfirst into projects with enthusiasm and approaching tasks with a positive, can-do attitude. Her eagerness to learn, grow, pitch-in and be part of the team has been a tremendous asset to us at CK, and will be a positive addition wherever she goes in the future.

summary: I am a writer and storyteller who can sometimes be found stage performing as a stand-up comedian, improv performer or telling stories. When not performing I run a creative agency, travel as much as possible and hang out with my teenage daughters, whom I use as fodder for onstage material and my forthcoming parenting book, Strategic Neglect: The art of #winning at parenting.I'd love to talk about your story.
name: Amber Pechin (Price)
title: Storyteller
